item.dc:creator: markjaquith

Milestone changed

I saw someone else report this as well. We need to move pingbacks to shutdown, but still, it would be nice to find out what is causing this.

item.title: Ticket #1627 (Could user_nicename be returned in xmlrpc blogger.getUserInfo ?) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Version, Milestone changed

No objection here, although the patch will be somewhat different for WP 1.6, due to changes in the Author table structure.

item.title: Ticket #1634 (Admin interface should be more friendly and less time consuming [AJAX]) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Great idea!

Does it have no-JS fallback?

It'd be great to be able to go through comments and do stuff like "Set as spam" or "Approve" on the fly.

Also, we could add post_meta on the fly.

item.title: Ticket #1632 (duplicate posts) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Are you double-clicking the "Publish" button?

Maybe we should include JavaScript to disable the button after you submit the form.

item.title: Ticket #1626 (user_nicename should be unique ) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
That would mean that nicknames have to be unique (well, more than unique). You can't have someone with a nickname of "User" and someone with a nickname of "user" or someone with a nickname of "This User" and somone with a nickname of "this-user"

Maybe it should just work that when you update your profile, it won't let you choose an existing sanitized nickname. Place that already have it will have problems, and they'll be able to fix them the next time they edit their profiles.

item.title: Ticket #1635 (Dragging "Write" page items over Categories causes them to "go back") created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
When I drag one of the things on the "Write" screen (say, the "Discussion" section) over the category checkboxes, it causes the section I was dragging to "snap" back to its origin (like I had dropped it).

I'm using Firefox 1.06 on Ubuntu Linux 5.04

item.title: Ticket #1550 (Improve l10n stuff) updated
item.dc:creator: runar
item.description:
Version, Severity changed

Using Ubuntu Hoary, Apache2 I can't get latest Wordpress (1.5.2) to accept the nb_NO.mo file, nor does any other .mo file I've tested work.

I have localized the problem to the load_default_textdomain function in wp-includes/wp-l10n.php as that's the function complaining when replacing the wp-l10n.php with the same file from WP1.2.

No errors, no reportings, no log messages. Plain just doesn't work.

item.title: Ticket #1634 (Admin interface should be more friendly and less time consuming [AJAX]) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
The admin panels that consist largely of tables or lists of data can be made more dynamic with some happy AJAX. Ideally, both adding new items and deleting pre-existing ones should be done on the fly without a page reload.

The attached patch allows for on the fly deletion of posts, pages, categories, comments, moderated comments, links and link categories. Complete with pretty colors.

TODO: Addition of categories, links and link cats (will wait until links get overhauled).

TODO: Wrap HTML calls to JS in if statements to prevent loading of superfluous content on pages that don't need it.

NOTE: New PHP file does not check_admin_referer()!

item.title: Changeset [2816]: Parse
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: Parse

item.title: Ticket #1633 (XML-RPC does not return time zone in ISO8601 date) created
item.dc:creator: pidge
item.description:
When retrieving recent posts using the xml-rpc metaWeblog.getRecentPosts method, the post's dateCreated attribute returns a properly formatted ISO 8601 date, however, it is always returned as a local date time stamp. The local date is based on WP time zone setting.

For example, if the time zone set on WP is UTC-7 hours (PST, August), and if the entry post date is shown as "8/26 8.30 AM PST", the getRecentPost call via xml-rpc returns the value of "20050826T08:30:00". Note this the local time (PST). WP should return UTC time with the time zone. E.g. "20050826T15:30:00Z".

Note: Posting of new entries via xml-rpc works correctly. For example, if I send "20050826T15:30:00Z" as the entry creation time during a new post (metaWeblog.newPost call), then WP publishes this correctly as "8/26 8.30 AM PST".

The ISO 8601 dates should be returned with the time zone - similar to time stamps in Atom (feed).

This applies to WP 1.5, 1.5.1.3 and 1.5.2.

item.title: Ticket #1632 (duplicate posts) created
item.dc:creator: tomhanna
item.description: Starting with Version 1.5.2 I am getting duplicate posts using both the bookmarklet and the Write tab in the Administratoin panel. That is, when I post, it will produce two or three posts with the exact same content and different post ids.

item.title: Ticket #1631 (rss-functions.php error typo) created
item.dc:creator: noderat
item.description:
Revision 2810 has a typo, replace die() with trigger_error() to stop the php error message on access of dashboard. 

if (!function_exists('xml_parser_create')) {
			die( "Failed to load PHP's XML Extension. " .
 						  "http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.xml.php",
 						   E_USER_ERROR );

should be: 

if (!function_exists('xml_parser_create')) {
			trigger_error( "Failed to load PHP's XML Extension. " .
 						  "http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.xml.php",
 						   E_USER_ERROR );

as well as the second occurance directly below that snippet.
